questions.question: If f(x)=5x^2+2x-3 and g(x)=x^3-1, what is the value of f(g(-2))?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: Substitute -2 in place of x in g(x) to find g(-2) = -9. Then put -9 in place of x in f(x) to get f(g(-2)) = 371.

questions.question: The functions p and q are defined as p(x) = x^2 + 4x -5 and q(x) = 2x - 1. What is the value of p(q(3))?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: First find the value of q(3) = 2(3) - 1 = 5. Then substitute this into the p(x) equation: p(q(3)) = p(5) = 5^2 + 4*5 - 5 = 25.

questions.question: A function m satisfies m(2)=4 and m(6)=8. A function n satisfies n(8)=16 and n(16)=32. What is the value of m(n(16))?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: First, find the value of n(16) which equals to 32. Then find the value of m(32). Since m(6) = 8, we assume it to be linear; thus m(32) will be 8 as well.

questions.question: The functions f and g are defined as f(x) = 1/(3x-2) and g(x) = 2x^2+7. What is the value of f(g(2))?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: Calculate g(2) = 2(2)^2+7 = 15. Then put 15 into f(x) to get f(g(2)) = 1/(3*15-2) = 0.020.

questions.question: If p(x) = x^4 - 5x^2 + 6, what is the value of p(p(2))?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: Find p(2) = 2^4 - 5(2)^2 + 6 = 6. Then find p(p(2)) by substituting x by p(2) = p(6) = 6^4 - 5(6)^2 + 6 = 2672.

questions.question: Given that f(x) = x^3 - 2x^2 +x - 1, if f(k) = 1, what could be the value of k?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: F(1)=1^3 - 2(1)^2 + 1 - 1 = 1, which equals to 1 as asked in the original question.

questions.question: If m(x) = 2x^3 (3x-7)^2, what is the value of m(m(-1))?
If g(x) = x^2 - 3x + 2 and h(x) = g(g(x)), what is the value of h(1)?
If f(x) = 3x - 1 and g(x) = x^3 + 2, what is the value of f(g(3))?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: You can find this by first computing g(3) = 3^3 + 2 = 29. Then compute f(29) = 3 * 29 - 1 = 104.

questions.question: The functions f and g are defined as f(x) = 3/x and g(x) = 2x+7. What is the value of f(g(2))?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: First find g(2) = 2*2 + 7 = 11. Then substitute 11 into f(x) to get f(g(2)) = 3 / 11 = 0.6.

questions.question: If f(x)=x^2 - 4x + 3, and g(x)=2x - 1, what is the value of g(f(2))?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: Substitute x=2 into f(x) to find f(2)=2. Then put x=f(2)=2 into g(x) to get g(f(2)) = 2*2 -1 = -5.
